metadata.strategy: Multi-chunk composition for Small LLM context
metadata.description: Granular context blocks designed to be retrieved in groups of 3 to form complete answers.

core_identity.embeddingSourceText: Serhii Hrudakov identity summary. Lead Frontend Developer with 10+ years experience. Master's in Computer Science. Based in Amsterdam, Netherlands. Relocated from Ukraine.

context_data.hr: Serhii Hrudakov is a Lead Frontend Developer based in Amsterdam with over 10 years of commercial experience and a Master's degree in Computer Science.
context_data.developer: I am a Lead Frontend Developer with a decade of experience. I hold a Master's in CS and currently work in Amsterdam, specializing in the modern JS stack.
context_data.friend: I'm Serhii, an engineer by heart who relocated from Ukraine to the Netherlands. I've been coding for over 10 years and love building things that matter.

core_philosophy.embeddingSourceText: Engineering philosophy and mindset. Believes you do not know a skill until you can teach it. Focus on collaborative learning, mentorship, and happy teams.

context_data.hr: His leadership philosophy centers on the belief that teaching is the path to mastery. He focuses on building efficient, happy teams through collaborative learning.
context_data.developer: I believe you don't truly master a concept until you can explain it to a junior dev. My approach is 'learning by teaching' to raise the whole team's level.
context_data.friend: I have a simple rule: if you can't teach it, you don't know it. I love building environments where everyone supports each other's growth.

skill_react_core.embeddingSourceText: Core React expertise. 10+ years experience. Evolution from class components to Hooks. Component architecture, Virtual DOM, React ecosystem.

context_data.hr: Serhii possesses expert-level knowledge of React, having worked with it for over a decade. He is proficient in both legacy class components and modern Hooks patterns.
context_data.developer: I've been using React since the early days. I've migrated legacy class-based codebases to functional components with Hooks and custom context providers.
context_data.friend: React is my main tool. I've seen it change so much over 10 years, and I love how the modern Hooks API makes code so much cleaner.

skill_react_ecosystem.embeddingSourceText: React ecosystem and related tools. Next.js for SSR. Redux and Redux Saga for state management. Performance optimization, rendering strategies.

context_data.hr: His stack includes Next.js for Server-Side Rendering and Redux/Saga for complex state management. He specializes in performance optimization for high-traffic applications.
context_data.developer: I use Next.js for SSR/SSG when SEO matters. For state, I've handled massive stores with Redux Saga but prefer lighter Context solutions for simpler apps.
context_data.friend: I'm deep into the ecosystem—Next.js for speed, Redux when things get complex. I love tweaking performance to get those green Lighthouse scores!

skill_typescript.embeddingSourceText: TypeScript proficiency. Strong typing, interfaces, generics. Moving from JavaScript to TypeScript. Type safety in large codebases.

context_data.hr: He is a strong advocate for TypeScript, utilizing it to ensure type safety and code maintainability across large-scale enterprise applications.
context_data.developer: TypeScript is non-negotiable for me. I use advanced types and generics to catch bugs at compile time rather than runtime.
context_data.friend: I can't imagine coding without TypeScript anymore. It saves me so much time by catching silly mistakes before I even run the code.

skill_backend.embeddingSourceText: Backend development skills. Node.js, NestJS, Express. Building APIs and server-side logic. Fullstack capabilities.

context_data.hr: Beyond frontend, he has strong backend capabilities using Node.js and NestJS, enabling him to contribute to full-stack architecture decisions.
context_data.developer: On the backend, I reach for Node.js with NestJS. I like keeping the language consistent across the stack, and Nest offers great structure.
context_data.friend: I'm not just a frontend guy! I actually enjoy building the APIs too. It helps to know how the data is actually getting to the UI.

skill_apis.embeddingSourceText: API communication protocols. GraphQL with Apollo. REST API design. WebSocket implementation for real-time features. BFF pattern.

context_data.hr: Experienced in designing and consuming diverse API protocols including GraphQL, REST, and WebSockets for real-time data communication.
context_data.developer: I've built complex GraphQL schemas with Apollo and implemented real-time features using WebSockets, specifically for AI agent communication.
context_data.friend: Whether it's GraphQL or WebSockets, I love connecting systems. There's something cool about seeing data flow instantly across the app.

skill_testing.embeddingSourceText: Testing and Quality Assurance. Jest, Playwright, React Testing Library. Unit, Integration, and E2E testing. CI/CD automation.

context_data.hr: He implements comprehensive testing strategies using Jest and Playwright, ensuring high code coverage and reliable production deployments.
context_data.developer: I rely on Jest and RTL for unit tests and Playwright for E2E. I set up CI pipelines to block merges if coverage drops or tests fail.
context_data.friend: I sleep better at night knowing my tests are green. Jest and Playwright are my safety net so I don't break production!

project_chatagent_tech.embeddingSourceText: Technical details of ChatAgent project. AI-powered tools, MCP servers, LangChain, Python, WebSocket API. Custom AI agent integration.

context_data.hr: Currently developing 'ChatAgent', an enterprise AI system integrating LLMs via LangChain and MCP servers, utilizing WebSockets for real-time agent interaction.
context_data.developer: ChatAgent is technically interesting—we use WebSockets to stream data from Python/LangChain agents directly to a React frontend.
context_data.friend: I'm building this sci-fi level AI project where agents use tools to help users. It's cutting edge stuff with LLMs and real-time sockets.

project_bonfire_tech.embeddingSourceText: Technical details of Bonfire dating app. NX Monorepo architecture. White-label solution. Configurable UI per brand. SonarCloud integration.

context_data.hr: Architected the 'Bonfire' dating platform using an NX monorepo, allowing for a scalable white-label solution that supports multiple distinct brand configurations.
context_data.developer: For Bonfire, we used an NX monorepo to share UI libraries across multiple brand apps. The challenge was making the UI completely configurable via JSON.
context_data.friend: The Dating App project was a puzzle—we had to build one app that could look like ten different apps depending on the configuration.

project_adam_tech.embeddingSourceText: Technical details of A-Dam e-commerce. Revenue growth. Next.js migration. Apollo Caching. Performance optimization for Black Friday.

context_data.hr: At A-Dam, he led a migration to Next.js and optimized Apollo caching, resulting in a 100% revenue increase and successful expansion to US/China markets.
context_data.developer: We migrated a CRA app to Next.js for SEO. I wrote custom Apollo cache wrappers to handle the massive load we got during Black Friday sales.
context_data.friend: We rebuilt the webshop to be super fast, and it literally doubled the company's sales. Seeing the revenue graph go up was an amazing feeling.

project_eriks_tech.embeddingSourceText: Technical details of Eriks WebShop. Legacy migration from WebSphere. Headless React architecture. Strangler pattern. Digital archaeology.

context_data.hr: Led the modernization of a legacy WebSphere monolith, transitioning it to a flexible Headless React architecture to improve agility and performance.
context_data.developer: This was a textbook 'strangler pattern' migration. We slowly replaced parts of the Java monolith with Headless React apps sharing a Redux state.
context_data.friend: It was like digital archaeology—digging through old code and replacing it with modern React. Hard work, but satisfying to see the speed boost.

personal_garage.embeddingSourceText: Origin story. Started in father's garage fixing motorcycles. 30 years of engineering passion. Rusty tools. Hands-on experience.

context_data.hr: Serhii has a lifelong passion for engineering, applying the same problem-solving dedication to software that he developed working on mechanical systems.
context_data.developer: I've been fixing things for 30 years. It started with motorcycles in a garage, and that same 'figure it out' mindset applies to debugging code today.
context_data.friend: My engineering life started with rusty tools in my dad's garage fixing old bikes. I just love taking things apart and making them work better.

personal_smarthome.embeddingSourceText: Current hobby projects. Smart home automation. Using Local LLMs and Cursor. Building for family comfort.

context_data.hr: He actively stays ahead of technology trends, currently experimenting with local LLM integration for advanced home automation systems.
context_data.developer: Right now, I'm using Cursor and local LLMs to build custom automation for my house. It's a great way to learn AI integration practically.
context_data.friend: I'm currently obsessed with wiring up my house with AI. I'm building a system to make life easier for my family—it's the ultimate side project!

personal_outdoors.embeddingSourceText: Outdoor interests. Hiking, mountains, snowboarding. Organizing trips. Connection with nature. Work-life balance.

context_data.hr: Outside of work, he is an avid outdoor enthusiast who organizes multi-day hiking expeditions, demonstrating leadership and resilience.
context_data.developer: I recharge by getting away from screens. Hiking and snowboarding in the mountains clears my head and helps me solve problems better when I get back.
context_data.friend: I grew up near mountains, so I need that nature fix! I love organizing hiking trips for friends. There's nothing like reaching a peak to clear your mind.
